Address.Street: 1621 Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. Drive

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1884 as Minister’s Institute
Founded 2014
Founded 1909 as a the Aggie School, an agricultural school. Became Arkansas State College 1933. Acquired present status and title 1967
GeneralInformation.AcademicYear: August to May (August-December; January-May). Also Summer Sessions (June-July; July-August)
AdmissionRequirements: Graduation from high school or equivalent, and College Board SAT or ACT examination
TOEFL test for foreign students and financial affidavit stating financial resources sufficient for proposed years of attendance

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1909 as Agricultural School, became Arkansas Polytechnic 1925, and acquired present status and title 1976. Merged with former Arkansas Valley Technical Institute - now known as ATU-Ozark Campus - 2003
AdmissionRequirements: Graduation from high school or equivalent, and College Board SAT, ACT, or ASSET examination
TOEFL test for foreign students

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1952
Founded 2005
Founded 1964
Founded 1975

Founded 1924 as Harding College, a senior college resulting from the merger of the Arkansas Christian College and Harper College. Acquired present status and title 1979. A private institution affiliated with the Church of Christ
GeneralInformation.AcademicYear: August to May (August-December; January-May). Also Summer Session (May-August)
AdmissionRequirements: Graduation from high school or equivalent, and College Board SAT or ACT examination
TOEFL test for foreign students

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1890 as Arkadelphia Methodist College, renamed Henderson College 1904, Henderson-Brown College 1911, Henderson State Teachers College 1929, Henderson State College 1967, acquired current status and title 1975. Is part of the Arkansas State University System
AdmissionRequirements: Graduation from high school or equivalent with a 2
5 GPA or higher, and College Board SAT or ACT examination, with a minimum score of 19 on the ACT (or equivalent SAT score)
TOEFL test for foreign students

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1876 as Central Institute, became Central Collegiate Institute 1881, purchased in 1884 by conferences of the Southern Methodist Church in Arkansas, acquired current status and title 1889
AdmissionRequirements: Graduation from high school or equivalent, and College Board SAT or ACT examination
TOEFL test for foreign students

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1919
Founded 1872 as Arkansas College, acquired current title 1994
Founded 1886 as Ouachita Baptist College. A private institution affiliated with the Arkansas Baptist State Convention (Southern Baptist)
AdmissionRequirements: Graduation from high school or equivalent, and College Board SAT or ACT examination
TOEFL test for foreign students

Address.Street: 900 West Daisy L Gatson Bates Drive

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1877 as the Walden Seminary, became Philander Smith College 1882, acquired current status and title 2023
Founded 1909 as Agricultural School, became Southern State College 1951, and acquired present title 1976. A State institution with a Branch Campus in East Camden
AdmissionRequirements: Graduation from high school or equivalent, and College Board SAT or ACT examination
TOEFL test for foreign students

Address.college_name: Strayer University – Strayer University-Little Rock Campus

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 2010. A campus of Strayer University, with the main campus located in Washington D.C.
Founded 1871 as the Arkansas Industrial University, academic activity began 1872. Acquired current title 1899. Is part of the University of Arkansas system
GeneralInformation.AcademicYear: August to May (August-December; January-May). Also Summer Session (May-August)
AdmissionRequirements: Graduation from high school or equivalent, and College Board SAT or ACT examination
TOEFL or IELTS test for foreign students

Address.college_name: University of Arkansas at Little Rock

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1927 as Little Rock Junior College. Became Little Rock University 1957, merged with the University of Arkansas System and acquired current title 1969
AdmissionRequirements: Graduation from high school or equivalent, and College Board SAT or ACT examination, 2
50 GPA
TOEFL test for foreign students

Divisions.College: Humanities, Arts, Social Sciences, and Education

FieldsOfStudy: Jr. Honors Programme and Donaghey Scholars Honors Programme

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1909 as the Fourth District Agricultural School, renamed  Agricultural and Mechanical College of the Fourth District 1925, accredited as a junior college 1928, renamed Arkansas Agricultural and Mechanical College 1939, accredited as a four-year institution 1940, became part of the University of Arkansas system 1971

Address.college_name: University of Arkansas at Pine Bluff

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1875 as Branch Normal College, a branch of Arkansas Industrial University, now the University of Arkansas (UA) in Fayetteville, Arkansas. Renamed Arkansas Agricultural, Mechanical and Normal College (AM&N) 1927, acquired current status and title 1972 when merged with the University of Arkansas system
AdmissionRequirements: Graduation from high school or equivalent

Address.college_name: University of Arkansas for Medical Sciences

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1879. Part of the University of Arkansas System
AdmissionRequirements: Graduation from high school or equivalent, and College Board SAT or ACT examination
TOEFL test for foreign students

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1951 as Grantham Radio License School, became Grantham University 1961, turned fully online 2000, joined the University of Arkansas System and acquired current title 2021. Formerly based in Missouri and identified as IAU-006769 in WHED

Founded 1928 by the local school board as an extension of the high school, Fort Smith Junior College (FSJC). Separated 1950 the college separated from the high school, renamed Westark Junior College (WJC) 1966 and then Westark Community College (WCC) 1972, became Westark College 1998, merged into the University of Arkansas system and acquired current status and title 2002

FieldsOfStudy: Electrical and Electronic Equipment and Maintenance

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1907 as the Arkansas State Normal School, renamed Arkansas State Teachers College 1925, State College of Arkansas 1967, acquired current status and title 1975
GeneralInformation.AcademicYear: August to May (August-December; January-May). Also Summer Session (June-August)
AdmissionRequirements: Graduation from high school or equivalent, and College Board SAT or ACT examination
TOEFL test for foreign students

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1834 as Cane Hill School, the all-male student institution closed 1861 due to civil war conscription, became co-ed 1875, closed 1891 and replaced by the Arkansas Cumberland College, The College of the Ozarks 1921, the first traditionally white college in Arkansas to admit African American students 1957, acquired current status and title 1987
Founded 1941 as Southern Baptist College, became Williams Baptist College 1991, acquired current title and status 2018
